process_steps.p_description: Combine Phase A in main beaker and mix with homogenization (3000 RPM) while heating to 80°C.
Combine Phase B2 in side beaker with propeller agitation while heating to 80°C.
Premix Phase B1 and add to Phase B2.
Once Phase A and Phase B1/ B2 are at 80°C, slowly add Phase B1/B2 to Phase A while homogenizing (3000 RPM) Homogenize for 5 minutes maintaining heat at 80°C .
Begin sweep mixing batch and cool to 35°C.
Add Phase C1 to Phase A/B1/ B2 and mix for 10 minutes. Take pH before proceeding to next step.
Add Phase C2 and mix until uniform.
Add Phase C3 while sweep mixing and continue to mix for 10 minutes at 150RPM.
Take pH and adjust to target range 4.8-5.

data.formula_base: Lecinol S-10 is a unique phospholipid emulsifier comprised mainly of Phosphatidylcholine which is the primary phospholipid found in the cell membrane of cells located in the epidermis. Lecinol S-10 creates an Oil-in-Water (O/W) emulsion in which some oil droplets have a lipid bilayer surrounding them which mimics the structure of the skin. It is a very potent emulsifier, stabilizing emulsions at low concentrations. Lecinol S-10 works to replenish the main phospholipid of the epidermis while also reducing skin damage, reducing irritation, reducing melanin synthesis, and increasing active deposition, strengthening the skin barrier, and providing instant and long term moisturization.

data.formula_base: NET-WRS is a polymeric emulsifier that creates jelly textures that can provide a water or oil break on skin. When neutralized, the polymer and surfactants interact causing a synergistic effect that results in a significant increase in viscosity and gives the system its unique gelling properties. It is a low energy system requiring no heat and low shear. It can be utilized to create innovative textures such as viscous sprayable gels, shape memory gels/emulsions, jelly textures and more.

data.formula_base: NET-APS is an Alpha-Gel emulsifier that forms a protective film on the skin. The unique lamellar arrangement for this type of Oil-in-Water (O/W) emulsion can control water loss from within the stratum corneum. NET-APS provides many beneﬁts such as ease of emulsiﬁcation for many types of oils, long lasting hydration, ﬁne line improvement, instant moisturization and long-term barrier improvement. It is an excellent system former for use in skin care, color, and lip formulations.

process_steps.p_description: Combine Phase A and mix until uniform while heating to 80°C.
Combine Phase B in a separate container and mix until uniform under propeller mixing. Heat Phase B to 80°C.
Add Phase A to Phase B under homogenization, maintain heat at 80°C. (Square ring  ~ 4000-5000 RPMS)
Pre-mix Phase C in a separate container, then add to Phase A/B under homogenization to ensure powder incorporation.
Once uniform move batch to sweep mixing to cool down to room temperature.
Once below 30°C, add Phase D sequentially to Phase A/B/C under sweep mixing.
Add remaining Phases under sweep mixing.
Once Phases have been added polish batch for 5 minutes under homogenization.
Record pH target 5-6, if batch needs to be adjusted utilize pH adjustors.

data.formula_base: Bartone MW-300 features a patented technology developed to allow the use of all types of oils such as silicones, esters, triglycerides, and hydrocarbons into water based fluid systems such as toners. Bartone MW-300 is a concentrated nano-emulsion which can simply be added to water to create milky white toners. This unique concentrate enables formulators to easily create nano-emulsion formulas without the use of high pressure homogenization.

process_steps.p_description: Add Phase A1 to a beaker, mix under propeller agitation until uniform.
Pre-mix Phase A2, add to Phase A1 under propeller agitation. Heat to 50°C. Once at temperature, mix for 20 minutes until clear and uniform.
Pre-mix Phase A3 then add to Phase A1/A2 and mix until uniform. Heat batch to 80°C with constant sweep mixing. To avoid burning, monitor batch to ensure there is constant movement.
In a separate beaker combine Phase B. Heat to 80°C and mix until uniform.

Once Phase A1/A2/A3 and Phase B reach 80°C, begin emulsification adding Phase B to Phase A1/A2/A3 under homogenization. (~4000- 5000 RPMs). Homogenize for additional 5 minutes once transfer is complete.
Stop homogenization and begin sweep mixing. At 45- 50°C, add remaining phases sequentially while continuing to mix.

data.formula_base: NET-LCS PF is a PEG-free complex that forms a multi-layer lamellar crystal structure that mimics the skin, consisting of similar components (phospholipids, fatty acids, triglycerides, etc.). These emulsions create a gel-cream that moisturizes the skin due to the fact that it entraps 13.0-19.0% bound water in the lamellar structure. NET-LCS PF emulsions were tested to increase moisturization, improve the condition of the stratum corneum and form a long lasting hydrophobic barrier on the skin.

data.formula_base: BarSperse-15 is a dispersing agent comprised of plant-derived polyglyceryl fatty acid ester. It has excellent oxidation and electrolyte stability, is almost odorless and imparts no color in formulations.

data.post_excerpt: Skin Dysbiosis (microbial imbalance) occurs in different situations such as acne, skin redness, and inflammation. Quorum Sensing, a communication system between microbes, has a key role within microbe to microbe and human to microbe interactions. Quoranys was developed as a way to jam the communication between bacteria specifically involved in acne to restore the biodiversity on the skin and improve the overall appearance of the skin.

data.post_excerpt: BioFense is a ferment created from probiotic bacteria, Lactobacillus plantarum. The fermentation involves providing a food source for the bacteria to thrive. This results in an abundance of Peptidoglycan and Lipotechoic Acid, which both induce beta-defensins. BioFense is a probiotic-like that favors the beneficial bacteria while discouraging harmful bacteria.

data.post_excerpt: AcquaCell is a natural complex combining Watermelon Rind Extract, Apple Extract, and Lentil Fruit Extract. AcquaCell hydrates skin for immediate and lasting results by supplying the skin with key Natural Moisturizing Factors. After two weeks of treatment with 3.00% AcquaCell the skin showed improvements in the key moisturizers; Sodium Lactate, Sodium PCA, and Citrulline and significantly reduced the appearance of fine lines, “plumping” the cells in 20 volunteers.

data.post_excerpt: Aesthigel is a type of carrageenan obtained by supercritical CO2 depolymerization of Furcellaria lumbricalis (Algae found in the Baltic Sea). It was tested in vivo to be a superior moisturizer when compared to Hyaluronic Acid, an industry standard. Hyaluronic Acid must be used for 2 weeks to reach the moisturization levels Aesthigel achieves in just 24 hours. An alternate version, Aesthigel PA, preserved with Phenethyl Alcohol is available upon request.

data.post_excerpt: Polyolprepolymer-2 (PP-2) forms a long-lasting liquid reservoir in the stratum corneum and epidermis. It decreases irritation and significantly influences the deposition of skin care and actives; yet, because of its high molecular weight, Polyolprepolymer-2 remains within the top layer of the skin. It is frequently used in color products such as foundations and concealers to help hold color in place, as well as sunscreen products for its ability to hold sunscreens in the upper layers of the skin.

data.post_excerpt: Bartone MW-300 features a patented technology developed to allow the use of all types of oils such as silicones, esters, triglycerides, and hydrocarbons into water based fluid systems such as toners. Bartone MW-300 is a concentrated nano-emulsion which can simply be added to water to create milky white toners. This unique concentrate enables formulators to easily create nano-emulsion formulas without the use of high pressure homogenization.

data.post_excerpt: NET-LCS PF is a PEG-free complex that forms a multi-layer lamellar crystal structure that mimics the skin, consisting of similar components (phospholipids, fatty acids, triglycerides, etc.). These emulsions create a gel-cream that moisturizes the skin due to the fact that it entraps 13.0-19.0% bound water in the lamellar structure. NET-LCS PF emulsions were tested to increase moisturization, improve the condition of the stratum corneum and form a long lasting hydrophobic barrier on the skin.

data.post_excerpt: NET-APS is an Alpha-Gel emulsifier that forms a protective film on the skin. The unique lamellar arrangement for this type of Oil-in-Water (O/W) emulsion can control water loss from within the stratum corneum. NET-APS provides many beneﬁts such as ease of emulsiﬁcation for many types of oils, long lasting hydration, ﬁne line improvement, instant moisturization and long-term barrier improvement. It is an excellent system former for use in skin care, color, and lip formulations.

data.post_excerpt: Lecinol S-10 is a unique phospholipid emulsifier comprised mainly of Phosphatidylcholine which is the primary phospholipid found in the cell membrane of cells located in the epidermis. Lecinol S-10 creates an Oil-in-Water (O/W) emulsion in which some oil droplets have a lipid bilayer surrounding them which mimics the structure of the skin. It is a very potent emulsifier, stabilizing emulsions at low concentrations. Lecinol S-10 works to replenish the main phospholipid of the epidermis while also reducing skin damage, reducing irritation, reducing melanin synthesis, and increasing active deposition, strengthening the skin barrier, and providing instant and long-term moisturization.

data.post_excerpt: NET WS-CF is a proprietary complex designed to create Water-in-Silicone macroemulsions that provides water break textures. NET WS-CF emulsions have light aesthetics during application due to the high-water phase present. Upon dry down a thin silicone film is provided leaving the skin feeling smooth. NET WS-CF is also highly recommended for color cosmetic emulsions as it stabilizes, suspends, and extends the wear of pigments. An alternate version with D5, NET-WO, is also available.

data.post_excerpt: Barsolve NS-100 is a multi-functional Polyglyceryl Fatty Acid Ester. This unique ingredient can function as a D-Phase emulsifier which are high internal phase emulsions with a small particle size. Once applied on the skin it melts into an oil and upon rinsing the oil self-emulsifies with water for easy rinsing. D-Phase emulsions can be easily dispersed into aqueous bases sebum cleanser or a natural solubilizer. It can also be dispersed into an aqueous gel to create a simple emulsion with low emulsifier content. D-Phase Emulsions are typically translucent gels (depending on the refractive index of the oil) that can contain up to 95% oil.

data.post_excerpt: NET-WRS is a polymeric emulsifier that creates jelly textures that can provide a water or oil break on skin. When neutralized, the polymer and surfactants interact causing a synergistic effect that results in a significant increase in viscosity and gives the system its unique gelling properties. It is a low energy system requiring no heat and low shear. It can be utilized to create innovative textures such as viscous sprayable gels, shape memory gels/emulsions, jelly textures and more.

data.post_excerpt: Angelys is extracted from the roots of Angelica acutiloba in Hokkaido and developed to disperse melanin in Keratinocytes. Angelys activates cathepsins, protease enzymes in lysosomal bags. Once reduced they digest the membrane of melanosomes (the bag of melanin) and disperse the melanin in the cell so the melanin becomes invisible to the eyes. When tested at 0.065%, Angelys increased Cathepsin K by 72%.

data.post_excerpt: BV-OSC is a highly stable oil soluble Vitamin C. Tested to outperform other forms of Vitamin C for its antioxidant and skin penetration effect. process_steps.p_description: Combine Phase A in main beaker and mix with homogenization (3000 RPM) while heating to 80°C.
Combine Phase B2 in side beaker with propeller agitation while heating to 80°C.
Premix Phase B1 and add to Phase B2.
Once Phase A and Phase B1/ B2 are at 80°C, slowly add Phase B1/B2 to Phase A while homogenizing (3000 RPM) Homogenize for 5 minutes maintaining heat at 80°C .
Begin sweep mixing batch and cool to 35°C.
Add Phase C1 to Phase A/B1/ B2 and mix for 10 minutes. Take pH before proceeding to next step.
Add Phase C2 and mix until uniform.
Add Phase C3 while sweep mixing and continue to mix for 10 minutes at 150RPM.
Take pH and adjust to target range 4.8-5.

data.formula_base: Lecinol S-10 is a unique phospholipid emulsifier comprised mainly of Phosphatidylcholine which is the primary phospholipid found in the cell membrane of cells located in the epidermis. Lecinol S-10 creates an Oil-in-Water (O/W) emulsion in which some oil droplets have a lipid bilayer surrounding them which mimics the structure of the skin. It is a very potent emulsifier, stabilizing emulsions at low concentrations. Lecinol S-10 works to replenish the main phospholipid of the epidermis while also reducing skin damage, reducing irritation, reducing melanin synthesis, and increasing active deposition, strengthening the skin barrier, and providing instant and long term moisturization.

Combine Phase B1 in a side beaker and heat to 80°C while homogenizing.
Premix Phase B2 and add to Phase B1 with homogenization.
Add Phase A to Phase B1/ B2 with homogenization. When transfer is complete, homogenize for 5 minutes at 5000 RPM. Maintain 80°C.
Cool batch to below 40°C with sweep mixing then add Phase C ingredients. Sweep mix until room temperature.

data.formula_base: NET-APS is an Alpha-Gel emulsifier that forms a protective film on the skin. The unique lamellar arrangement for this type of Oil-in-Water (O/W) emulsion can control water loss from within the stratum corneum. NET-APS provides many beneﬁts such as ease of emulsiﬁcation for many types of oils, long lasting hydration, ﬁne line improvement, instant moisturization and long-term barrier improvement. It is an excellent system former for use in skin care, color, and lip formulations.

process_steps.p_description: In a beaker, add Phase A ingredients and disperse using homogenization (silverson, circular screen). Increase RPM to 4000-5000 RPM to fully disperse NET- WS-CF.  Mix until uniform.
In a separate beaker, add Phase B and mix for 5 minutes and until uniform with stir bar or propeller.
Once Phase B  is uniform, add Phase B slowly to Phase A under homogenization at 4000-5000RPM. Homogenize for 5 minutes after addition is complete.
Add Phase C to Phase A/B under homogenization sequentially.
Add Phase D to Phase A/B/C under sweep mixing.

data.formula_base: NET WS-CF is a proprietary complex designed to create Water-in-Silicone macroemulsions that provides water break textures. NET WS-CF emulsions have light aesthetics during application due to the high-water phase present. Upon dry down a thin silicone film is provided leaving the skin feeling smooth. NET WS-CF is also highly recommended for color cosmetic emulsions as it stabilizes, suspends, and extends the wear of pigments.

process_steps.p_description: Combine Phase A and mix until uniform while heating to 80°C.
Combine Phase B in a separate container and mix until uniform under propeller mixing. Heat Phase B to 80°C.
Add Phase A to Phase B under homogenization, maintain heat at 80°C. (Square ring  ~ 4000-5000 RPMS)
Pre-mix Phase C in a separate container, then add to Phase A/B under homogenization to ensure powder incorporation.
Once uniform move batch to sweep mixing to cool down to room temperature.
Once below 30°C, add Phase D sequentially to Phase A/B/C under sweep mixing.
Add remaining Phases under sweep mixing.
Once Phases have been added polish batch for 5 minutes under homogenization.
Record pH target 5-6, if batch needs to be adjusted utilize pH adjustors.

data.formula_base: Barcril-AV is a sodium salt of acrylic copolymer, an absorbent powder which holds more than 20 times its dry weight in water. Formulations featuring the Barcril-AV technology release water when applied to the skin and provide a unique change in texture during application while leaving a soft powdery finish.

data.formula_base: Bartone MW-300 features a patented technology developed to allow the use of all types of oils such as silicones, esters, triglycerides, and hydrocarbons into water based fluid systems such as toners. Bartone MW-300 is a concentrated nano-emulsion which can simply be added to water to create milky white toners. This unique concentrate enables formulators to easily create nano-emulsion formulas without the use of high pressure homogenization.

process_steps.p_description: Add Phase A1 to a beaker, mix under propeller agitation until uniform.
Pre-mix Phase A2, add to Phase A1 under propeller agitation. Heat to 50°C. Once at temperature, mix for 20 minutes until clear and uniform.
Pre-mix Phase A3 then add to Phase A1/A2 and mix until uniform. Heat batch to 80°C with constant sweep mixing. To avoid burning, monitor batch to ensure there is constant movement.
In a separate beaker combine Phase B. Heat to 80°C and mix until uniform.

Once Phase A1/A2/A3 and Phase B reach 80°C, begin emulsification adding Phase B to Phase A1/A2/A3 under homogenization. (~4000- 5000 RPMs). Homogenize for additional 5 minutes once transfer is complete.
Stop homogenization and begin sweep mixing. At 45- 50°C, add remaining phases sequentially while continuing to mix.

data.formula_base: NET-LCS PF is a PEG-free complex that forms a multi-layer lamellar crystal structure that mimics the skin, consisting of similar components (phospholipids, fatty acids, triglycerides, etc.). These emulsions create a gel-cream that moisturizes the skin due to the fact that it entraps 13.0-19.0% bound water in the lamellar structure. NET-LCS PF emulsions were tested to increase moisturization, improve the condition of the stratum corneum and form a long lasting hydrophobic barrier on the skin.

data.formula_base: BarSperse-15 is a dispersing agent comprised of plant-derived polyglyceryl fatty acid ester. BarSperse-15 is an excellent dispersing aid of pigments and inorganic sunscreens in an oily medium that can be used in a variety of applications such as lipsticks, foundations, mascaras and many other formulations. It has excellent oxidation and electrolyte stability, is almost odorless and imparts no color in formulations.
